intro: Ferocactus hamatacanthus var. sinuatus, commonly known as the sinuous hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are ribbed and covered with sharp, spiny areoles. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which are typically borne in clusters at the tips of the stems. Its leaves are modified into spines, and it has a deep root system adapted to store water. This cactus is well-suited to xerophytic environments and requires minimal water once established.
